sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: Access control policy; proced</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).  Systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  Determine if the information system </assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline/> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>The information system binds security attributes to information using CMS approved processes and procedures to facilitate information flow policy enforcement.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Access Control">408779fcdb211010280df36f29961977</control_family> <control_name>Security Attribute Binding</control_name> <control_number>AC-04(18)</control_number> <control_type>Non-Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>AC-04</group_id> <group_list/> <high>false</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards/> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>false</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>false</moderate> <number>ARSC0010816</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:21</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>1</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>OMB Memo: M-17-12, M-06-16; OMB Circular A-130: 7.g. w/Section 8 and Appendix III; 45 C.F.R. ยง164.306(a)</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>AC-16, SC-16</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Binding techniques implemented by information systems affect the strength of security attribute binding to information. Binding strength and the assurance associated with binding techniques play an important part in the trust organizations have in the information flow enforcement process. The binding techniques affect the number and degree of additional reviews required by organizations.Binding security attributes is the process of associating (i.e., binding) security attributes to information within information systems to facilitate automated access enforcement and flow enforcement actions. See AC-16 for additional information.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  To have a high level of trust in the information flow of sensitive information such as PII, this control ensures the security attributes selected in AC-16 are bound to the information.To ensure the protection of PII throughout its information flow, this control should be used to protect PII as it travels within and among information systems and information system components, such as database servers, application servers, shared storage environments, document repositories, and file folders.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:21</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>c487b9fcdb211010280df36f29961910</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:21</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
